item.title: Best Batman Games That Lived Up To The Hype, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Batman games broke the superhero video game curse in the early 2000s.
  • Several Batman games lived up to the enormous hype by innovating and delivering top-notch gameplay.
  • The Batman game franchise set a new gold standard for interactive superhero storytelling.

The reputation of superhero video games wasn’t great in the early 2000s, largely due to the rushed movie tie-ins and shallow brawlers that failed to capture the spirit of their source material. But then came Batman — a character synonymous with mythic expectations and, as it turned out, the one to shatter the status quo. Over the last fifteen years, the Batman game franchise didn’t just raise the bar for interactive superhero stories; it built a whole separate rooftop for itself.

Each major Batman release carried the burden of enormous hype, and a select few managed to exceed the expectations. Some reinvented entire genres, others polished formulas, and a handful reimagined The Dark Knight’s world in ways that caught even the skeptics off guard. And so, here are some of those Batman games that truly lived up to the hype, ranked and celebrated for what made each of them stand out.

7 Batman: Arkham Shadow (2024)

The Caped Crusader Entered New Dimensions Through VR

Batman: Arkham Shadow
8 /10
9.9 /10
Released
October 21, 2024

ESRB
T For Teen // Violence, Mild Blood, Language
Platform(s)
Meta Quest 3, Meta Quest 3S
Powered by

Breaking new ground isn’t easy, especially when the legacy is as heavy as Batman’s . But Arkham Shadow does exactly that by translating the Arkham formula into the first-person world of VR. Fans were buzzing before launch, as this was the Arkhamverse’s long-awaited return after years away, now exclusive to the Meta Quest 3 and promising a full AAA campaign in virtual reality.

The game dropped with widespread positive reception from critics, and fans agreed that the signature blend of brawler combat, stealth, and detective work was shockingly well-realized in first person. Of course, this high-tech leap didn’t land flawlessly: launch bugs, control hiccups, and hardware limits were real headaches for some. But when the VR immersion clicks, the experience is priceless. It is as close as any gamer has come to living the fantasy.

6 LEGO Batman 2: DC Super Heroes (2012)

Blocky Gotham Got Big and Bold With an Open World

LEGO Batman 2: DC Super Heroes
7 /10
8.5 /10
Released
June 19, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Cartoon Violence
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, PS Vita, Nintendo DS, 3DS, Wii, Nintendo Wii U, Xbox 360, Android, iOS
Powered by

For a game built out of bricks, LEGO Batman 2 was a wrecking ball for its own franchise. The pre-release buzz was all about two firsts: a fully open-world Gotham and, finally, actual voice acting for LEGO’s cast of heroes and villains. The hype paid off. Fans didn’t just get a charming family Batman romp, but a massive, explorable city and an original story that poked fun at every corner of DC lore.

Flying through Gotham, switching between Batman’s endless gadgets, and gathering a Justice League-sized roster made every session a playground. For many, LEGO Batman 2 was the game that made the LEGO formula grow up, and the one that gave superhero games permission to be both silly and smart.

5 Batman: Arkham Origins (2013)

Overcame Skepticism By Delivering The Best Boss Battles

Batman: Arkham Origins
8 /10
8.0 /10
Released
October 25, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Platform(s)
Nintendo Wii U, PC, PlayStation 3, Xbox 360
Powered by

Arkham Origins takes players back to a time when Gotham feels colder and rougher, with a young Batman on the run from assassins during a chaotic Christmas Eve. The game’s hype came as a mix of hope for more Arkham brilliance and nerves about a new developer. Even though the initial reviews were mixed, the game later turned into a fan favorite.

What flipped the script was the boss battles. Few fights in the series land as hard as Deathstroke’s or pack as much punch as Bane’s relentless attacks. These moments quickly became legendary, and the game’s focus on Batman’s earliest clashes with the Joker and his rocky partnership with Alfred gave fans something to talk about.

4 Batman: The Enemy Within (2017)

Telltale's Narrative Masterpiece And the Creation of Joker

Batman: The Enemy Within
Point-and-click
Adventure
Systems
Released
August 8, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M // Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PC, Switch, PS4, Xbox One
Powered by

No Batmobile. No open world. No gadget upgrades. Instead, Telltale’s The Enemy Within set its sights on the one thing no other Batman game dared: letting players decide the Joker’s fate. Building on the bold storytelling of Telltale’s first Batman season, this sequel made one promise that created hype. The player's choices shape the birth (or downfall) of the greatest villain in comics.

What followed was one of the most acclaimed narrative-driven superhero games ever. The “John Doe” arc puts the player in control of the Joker’s transformation, allowing for wildly divergent endings. Underneath the comic book style and dialogue trees, The Enemy Within proved that player agency could rewrite Batman’s most iconic rivalry.

3 Batman: Arkham Knight (2015)

Grand Spectacle, High Stakes, and A Divisive Batmobile

Batman: Arkham Knight
9 /10
22
8.5 /10
Released
June 23, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
Powered by

Every trilogy needs a grand finale, and Arkham Knight swung for the fences with a Gotham five times bigger, a playable Batmobile, and a psychological war at its heart. The expectations? Through the roof. The payoff? Fans were treated to dazzling visuals, tight combat, and stealth gameplay that made every rooftop and alley feel alive.

Combat feels sharper than ever, with new enemy types and slick dual takedowns that allow Batman to team up with allies in the heat of battle. The Batmobile, now fully driveable, steals the spotlight this time. The narrative cuts deeper, with Scarecrow’s full-scale assault on Gotham and a psychological duel against the Joker’s lingering shadow.

2 Batman: Arkham Asylum (2009)

Shattered All Expectations And Redefined Superhero Games

Batman: Arkham Asylum
17
9.6 /10
Released
August 25, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol and Tobacco Reference, Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Platform(s)
PS3, PS4, macOS, PC, Xbox 360, Xbox One
Powered by

Batman: Arkham Asylum arrived in 2009 and single-handedly revitalized a genre that was on the brink of saturation. By blending brawler combat, stealth hunting, and gadget-based exploration, Rocksteady Studios broke all expectations and created a new gold standard.

The Freeflow combat, now legendary, made every punch feel earned. Predator encounters, where players stalk terrified thugs from the shadows, rewired how gamers thought about stealth. A strong story written by Paul Dini, Mark Hamill’s standout performance as the Joker, and a dark, gothic world combined to create a game that won awards, broke records, and set a new standard for superhero games.

1 Batman: Arkham City (2011)

Gotham’s Ultimate Playground and Genre Classic

Batman: Arkham City Lockdown
Action-Adventure
Systems
10.0 /10
Released
December 7, 2011
ESRB
T For Teen

Platform(s)
Android, iOS
Powered by

If Arkham Asylum started the legend, Arkham City made it immortal. The sequel’s hype was immense, because how does a developer improve on near-perfection? The developers answered: by taking everything great and making it bigger, deeper, and richer, without losing the focus that made the original a hit. Traversal was transformed into a thrilling skill in itself, grappling, dive-bombing, and gliding across a dense city filled with secrets, side missions, and villains.

Combat got faster and more technical, with a broader arsenal and tougher enemies. Every major villain, from Penguin to Mr. Freeze, had a moment in the spotlight, but it was the Joker’s story (and Batman’s tragic, iconic choice) that hit hardest. Arkham City proved the Bat can fly so much higher, and every superhero game since has been chasing that shadow.

item.title: Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 Reveals PC System Requirements
item.description:
Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 has revealed the system requirements players will need to meet in order to play the game on PC. Though Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 is built in Unreal Engine 5, players should find the title to be fairly accessible, at least at the minimum system requirements.

Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 has been awaited by fans for a long time now, but the game is finally approaching the finish line. Initially announced in 2019 as the follow-up to the 2004 Troika game, Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 has since seen multiple delays, as well as the removal of individual members of the development team, and eventually, changing developers entirely. With Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 cementing an October 2025 release date, expectant fans can now ensure their PCs are up to the task.

Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 PC System Requirements

Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 has now revealed its specs on its official website, highlighting what players will need at the minimum to play, and what's recommended. The minimum required specs should be pretty easy for most modern gaming PCs to meet. It calls for Windows 10 64-bit, an Intel Core i3-8350K or AMD Ryzen 3 3300X, 8GB of RAM, and an Nvidia GeForce GTX 1060 (6GB), AMD Radeon RX 480 (8GB), Intel Arc A580 (8 GB, Resizable BAR enabled) or AMD Radeon 780M. Given the Nvidia GeForce GTX 1060 launched nearly a decade ago, these system requirements seem quite reasonable.

To play the game at its recommended settings, players will need Windows 11, plus at least an Intel Core i5-12600K or AMD Ryzen 5 5600X CPU, 16GB of RAM, and Nvidia GeForce RTX 3060 Ti (8GB) or AMD Radeon RX 6700 XT (12GB). Surprisingly, the game only needs 30 GB of hard drive space, which is significantly less storage space required by many modern game releases.

With any luck, gamers find that the game is enjoyable at launch. Even following development shifts and delays, Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2 has seen some significant issues in the final stretch, including controversy surrounding locking two vampire clans behind DLC, namely Lasombra and Toreador. The developers have since announced that adjustments would be made, and PlayStation has begun refunding players for the Premium Edition of Bloodlines 2 , which was set to include the DLC with those clans. In any case, players won't have to wait too much longer to see if the sequel lives up to the cult classic original.

Follow
Followed
Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2
Action RPG
Systems
Released
October 21, 2025
ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Intense Violence, Blood and Gore, Sexual Themes, Nudity, Drug Reference, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Hardsuit Labs
Publisher(s)
Paradox Interactive
Engine
Source
Franchise
Vampire the Masquerade
PC Release Date
October 21, 2025
Xbox Series X|S Release Date
October 21, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Powered by

item.title: Grow a Garden: Best Pets Tier List
item.description:
With Roblox 's Grow a Garden animal update, the devs have really stepped up the game by adding a ton of fun new content. Now, besides growing fruits and taking care of your garden, you can also have some pets, just like Pet Simulator 99 . These animals aren't just a cute addition to your farm; they also boost your crops and improve your player experience in some pretty cool ways.

Some pets will make your fruits and veggies mutate, while others will make them bigger or even give you free fruits and seeds. To get them, though, you’ll need to buy and hatch their eggs, which can cost a lot of Sheckles. So, it’s important to know which animals are worth it. If you’re looking to spend wisely, here's a ranking of the animals in Grow a Garden from least to most valuable .

Updated on September 7, 2025, by Somiya Adrees: The tier list below in this guide has been refreshed to include every pet available up to the 1.22.0 update, including all the time-limited pets as well; this should help players decide which pets to keep, trade, or let go.

Grow a Garden: All Pets Tier List

Currently, Grow a Garden is home to 136 animals, each with its own unique abilities. Think of them as walking gear. They can do stuff like turn your crops into mutated ones, water your plants, speed up sprinklers, or even search out free seeds for you.

You can only have three animals active in your garden at a time (unless you've snagged more pet slots), but the good news is that any extras you hatch won’t go to waste. You can swap them in and out whenever you like for a fresh vibe or to enjoy their different perks. Here’s a simple tier list of all the animals in Grow a Garden , with reasons why some are more useful than others:

All Animals

Tier Ranking

Type

Reasoning

Kitsune

S Tier

Fruit-Stealing Pet

Right now, the best pet in Grow a Garden. It can apply a Chakra Mutation (15x value) to a fruit from a nearby garden , or even a Foxfire Chakra (90x value), and give it to you.

Dragonfly

S Tier

Variant Pet

Gives a guaranteed Gold plant every five minutes (worth 20x more). It's hard to say no to that.

Disco Bee

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Activates the Disco mutation on crops (125x value) nearly every 20 minutes, with a 12.28% chance each time.

Raccoon

S Tier

Fruit-Stealing Pet

Gives free fruit every 15 minutes by cloning one from a neighbor’s garden .

Cockatrice

S Tier

Multiple Traits

A multi-talented critter that adds Gold and Silver variants to your plants. It can also do one of three things at a time: hatch eggs faster, give crops Toxic Mutation (15x), or help pets earn more Experience Points.

Corrupted Kitsune

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Turns nine fruits in your garden into either Corrupt Chakra (15x value) or Corrupt Foxfire Chakra (90x value) variants.

Mimic Octopus

S Tier

Ability Cloner

Mimics the ability of an active pet . Best when paired with other S-tier animals.

Butterfly

S Tier

Variant Pet

Applies Rainbow mutation (50x) to plants with five mutations every 30 minutes (skips favorited ones).

French Fry Ferret

S Tier

Aging Pet

Best critter for aging pets, as it grants 1 level to a random pet every 20 minutes to an hour. Great for farming pet age to trigger mutations.

Spinosaurus

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Eats one mutation from four plants and puts them all on a single fruit , preferring to bless one of your favorited plants.

T-Rex

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Eats a mutation from a random fruit grown on your farmland and then pours it onto three to four different fruits .

Fennec Fox

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Copies a random mutation from your neighbor's garden and triggers it on one of your crops .

Brontosaurus

S Tier

Size Booster

It’s the first animal that can give you big pets by adding a size and weight bonus to hatched eggs.

Golden Goose

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Lays a Golden Egg, which is actually a plant with the Fortune Mutation (50x multiplier). Selling this egg-like crop might pass the Fortune Mutation to one of the fruits in your garden.

Griffin

S Tier

Mutation Pet & Cooldown Pet

Comes with two abilities: triggers Cyclonic mutation (50x) and shortens pet cooldowns by 67 seconds on contact.

Luminous Sprite

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Lets you obtain Luminous mutated fruits worth 50x.

Lemon Lion

S Tier

Mutation Pet & XP Booster

Forces Brainrot Mutation (100x) on fruits and adds XP to a random pet’s bar.

Seal

S Tier

Egg Giver

Can give you the egg of a pet you just sold , meaning you can keep selling unwanted Mythicals and Divines for Mythical and Bug Eggs to try for your desired pets.

Queen Bee

S Tier

Cooldown & Mutation

Great as a support critter for Raccoon, Red Fox, Disco Bee, and more, since it fully resets a random pet’s ability cooldown . Also applies the Pollinated mutation (3x value) to a nearby crop roughly every 25 minutes.

Red Fox

S Tier

Seed Pet

Steals (duplicates) a plant seed from a neighbor’s farm (Seed Shop ones only).

Glimmering Sprite

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Super useful in the ongoing Fairy Update since it mutates your fruits with Glimmering Mutation , which you need to complete the event, making it part of the current meta.

Chicken Zombie

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Grants your fruits the Zombified Mutation (25x multiplier).

Praying Mantis

S Tier

Variant Pet

Triggers either a Gold or Rainbow mutation on fruits, boosting their value. Definitely a must-have if you're aiming for higher stacking bonuses.

Lobster Thermidor

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Applies Molten (25x value) or the admin-special Meteoric (125x) mutation to a plant in your garden.

Pancake Mole

S Tier

Resource Pet

Can find Sheckles, all types of Sprinklers (including Mater and Grandmaster ), Trowel, Recall Wrench, Harvest Tool, Lightning Rod, and Watering Can.

Shiba Inu

S Tier

Seed Pet

More chance to dig up a seed than Golden Lab. Improve its ability by using Nihonzaru or giving it Gold or Rainbow pet mutations.

Blood Owl

S Tier

XP Booster

Makes all your active pets age faster .

Firefly

S Tier

Mutation Pet

Turns your crops Shocked (50x multiplier).

Phoenix

A Tier

Multiple Traits

When pets are processed in the mutation machine, they come out aged up to 4 years. Additionally, the critter grants a 20% chance to apply Flaming Mutation (25x) to four fruits in your garden.

Wisp

A Tier

XP Booster

Allows all active pets in your garden to gain experience points per second , but only if a Wisp Well is placed.

Peach Wasp

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Adds the once admin-only Plasma Mutation to fruits and pushes forward a random pet’s cooldown.

Mole

A Tier

Resource Pet

Can dig up free gear for you every 80 seconds (i.e., Sprinklers, Lightning Rod, Trowel) and also Sheckles.

Tanuki

A Tier

Multiple Traits

Messes around in your garden by adding mutations like Choc (2x), Chilled (2x), Moonlit (2x) and more to one of your fruits; it may also grant Sheckles , age itself, or do other activities.

Apple Gazelle

A Tier

Multiple Traits

Applies Warped Mutation (75x) to apple-type fruits when picked up and also duplicates them .

Sand Snake

A Tier

Resource Pet

Clone tools from the Gear Shop (like Sprinklers, Tanning Mirrors, Magnifying Glass, and more) and seeds from the Seed Shop when making a purchase, meaning you might get two instead of one with a 1.45% chance.

Axolotl

A Tier

Harvest Related

Best for making Sheckles, as it gives you a 6.54% chance for summer fruits to stay on their plants . Most of those are top-tier, like Traveler’s Fruit, Lily of the Valley, and Guanabana, so you can collect more of them when harvesting.

Petal Bee

A Tier

Multiple Traits

Ideal for farming Pollinated Fruits (Queen Bee-like timer) and keeping flowers after harvest , especially high-value ones like Sunflower, Moon Blossom, Purple Dahlia, and Pink Lily.

Ankylosaurus

A Tier

Resource Pet

Might return stolen plants to your inventory while it’s active.

Pachycephalosaurus

A Tier

Resource Pet

When crafting items, it may grant you a bonus item of the same kind.

Triceratops

A Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Literally the best pet to use if you want multiple plants to grow fruits quickly .

Tanchozuru

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Adds the Tranquil mutation (20x value) to all crop types in your garden.

Junkbot

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Forces the Oil mutation (15x multiplier) on a random plant (14.52% chance).

Cooked Owl

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Can give your crops the Burnt (4x value) or Cooked (25x value) mutation roughly every 15 minutes, with a 15.28% chance to activate. Also grants active animals an extra 0.17 experience points.

Sushi Bear

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Offers better odds of triggering Frozen (10x value) or Chilled (2x value) mutations than a Polar Bear (15%) and can also feed pets to keep them full.

Raiju

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Removes the Shocked mutation from a fruit and applies the Static (8x value) mutation to four fruits in your garden. During thunderstorms, it may apply the Shocked mutation instead of Static. Favorited fruits are ignored.

Spaghetti Sloth

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Blesses plants with either Sauce (3x value), Meatball (3x value), or Pasta (4x value) every 3 to 14 minutes. Combining all three grants the Spaghetti (15x value) mutation.

Spriggan

A Tier

Mutation Pet

This critter has a 15.21% chance to apply the Bloom mutation (8x value) to nearby plants.

Pig

A Tier

Variant Pet

Has a higher chance of granting Gold and Rainbow variants than the Praying Mantis (2.2% every two minutes), but its cooldown is longer in comparison. It’s a decent pick, though not as rewarding as the Mantis.

Pterodactyl

A Tier

Jump Height & Mutation

Increases your character’s jump height and flaps its wings to give three to four fruits the Windstruck Mutation (2x Value), and sometimes even the Twisted Mutation (5x Value).

Hyacinth Macaw

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Like the Cloudtouched Mutation Spray, it gives your crops the Cloudtouched mutation (6x multiplier) every eight minutes, though the probability is only 15.74%.

Bear Bee

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Acts just like a Honey Sprinkler, granting a confirmed HoneyGlazed mutation (5x value) to fruits every 25 minutes.

Gnome

A Tier

Mutation Pet

Applies Gnomed Mutation (15x) and gives a 1.05% chance to pull Gnomed-type cosmetics from crates.

Mandrake

A Tier

Mutation Pet

While active in your garden, there is a 3% chance to apply Rod Mutation (8x) to a random fruit.

Sea Turtle

A Tier

Mutation & XP Booster

Sends about 1,000 XP to a random pet every 11 minutes and makes a fruit Wet (2x value).

Moon Cat

A Tier

Plant Growth & Harvest Related

Boosts fruit size (1.51x) and keeps Lunar and Blood Moon plants from disappearing after harvest (with only a 6.1% chance).

Moth

A Tier

Aging Pet

Keeps your pets' Hunger Bar full every 13 minutes, helping them age faster and perform better (Variant pets can give higher-tier mutations, and seed diggers can find better seeds.)

Ostrich

A Tier

Aging Pet

Lets your hatched pets come with an age of one to four.

Silver Monkey

A Tier

Resource Pet

When you sell fruit, it might pop back into your inventory (even mutated ones like Shocked, Gold, or Rainbow). The rarer it is, the lower the chance.

Blood Hedgehog

A Tier

Plant Growth & Variant

Best if you have lots of prickly fruits (i.e., Durian, Cactus, Dragon Fruit, and Pineapple) on your farm, as this critter can make them larger and increase their chances of getting Gold and Rainbow variants.

Red Giant Ant

A Tier

Harvest Related

Can copy your plants when you pick them (even Divine ones).

Tarantula Hawk

A Tier

Cooldown & Mutation

Similar to Queen Bee , but only advances pet cooldown by 1.3 minutes. Useful if you haven’t unlocked Queen Bee yet.

Pack Bee

A Tier

Inventory Pet

Used to expand your inventory slots , letting you hold more fruits, pets, and seeds.

Starfish

A Tier

XP Booster

A situational critter that gains 6.36 XP every second . Best used when you're trying to unlock extra pet slots. It's even better than any Brown Mouse, as it can earn you 3,816 experience points every 10 minutes.

Golden Lab

A Tier

Seed Pet

Digs up random seeds ( Common to Divine) . Perfect for farming while you're AFK.

Capybara

A Tier

XP Booster

Critters within its radar won’t lose hunger and will gain XP every second instead.

Snail

A Tier

Seed Pet

Can sometimes give you a seed from the plant you just harvested .

Blood Kiwi

A Tier

Hatch Related

Can greatly reduce your eggs' hatch time (by 45 seconds per minute) and increase hatch speed by 20%.

Koi

A Tier

Egg Giver

May return the eggs you hatch while they’re swimming around your plot.

Turtle

A Tier

Sprinkler Pet

Mainly works with sprinklers, making them last longer .

Night Owl

A Tier

XP Booster

Has the same ability as Blood Owl but isn’t as good.

Hotdog Daschund

A Tier

Cooldown and XP Booster

Can give experience points or advance a pet’s cooldown every 3.57 minutes with a 20% chance.

Green Bean

A Tier

Harvest Related

Sometimes sacrifices a random Beanstalk fruit to instantly grow another plant in your garden, giving it a fruit size bonus .

Imp

A Tier

Resource Pet

Plays a catch game with you, and if you grab it, you get rewards like gear and event items .

Cardinal

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Makes all magic-type plants (e.g., Fairy event plants) grow 1.6x faster.

Shroomie

B Tier

Size Booster

Causes fungus-type plants in your garden to grow larger, like Mushrooms, Duskpuff, Horned Dinoshroom, etc.

Pixie

B Tier

Float + Plant Growth Pet

Pixie can let you and nearby players levitate by jumping in its circle (not always guaranteed) and speeds up nearby fruit growth by 30s.

Ladybug

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Speeds up all flower-type crops by 1.6x , making Tranquil Bloom, Moon Blossom, Poseidon Plant, and more grow faster than usual.

Scarlet Macaw

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Has a chance to bless a nearby fruit with a Verdant mutation (4x value) every 11.51 minutes, though the chance is only 15.95%.

Bacon Pig

B Tier

Variant Pet

Same as the Pig, it raises the odds of nearby plants growing as Gold or Rainbow variants , though it takes a bit longer to activate in comparison.

Sunny-Side Chicken

B Tier

Hatch Related

Useful for hatching, as it increases hatch speed by 20.27%.

Corrupted Kodama

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Provides Corrupt mutated fruits (20x multiplier),

Polar Bear

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Has a 10.12% chance to grant you a Chilled or Frozen fruit every 1.49 minutes.

Jackalope

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Turns nearby fruits into a Sandy variant worth 3x their value every 99.3 seconds, with a 15.64% chance.

Football

B Tier

Resource Pet

You can get Sheckles or a Watering Can by running around the related shops.

Kappa

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Waters your plants to give them the Wet mutation (2x value), or alternatively transforms Wet fruits into Bloodlit (5x value).

Squirrel

B Tier

Reclaimer & XP Booster

Might save a single use of your Reclaimer and gain some experience points per second.

Nihonzaru

B Tier

Passive Booster

Increases the passive ability of all active critters, improving their traits only if you’ve got a Hot Spring in your plot.

Elk

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

Berry fruits have a 2% chance to remain after harvest.

Iguanodon

B Tier

Aging Pet

A special pet that helps age all your active dinos by transferring XP to them.

Parasaurolophus

B Tier

Speed-Up Pet

Mostly just helps you open up those cosmetic crates faster.

Raptor

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Has a small chance of giving you the Amber Mutation (10x Value) on harvested fruits and also boosts your walking speed.

Seedling

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Lets you swap mutations between two plants , so you can farm mutations on your best ones. Thankfully, it ignores favorited plants.

Stegosaurus

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

Lets you snag a bonus fruit when picking plants . Prehistoric crops have better odds than other rare ones. It’s super useful when harvesting a Bone Blossom plant.

Dilophosaurus

B Tier

XP Booster

Gives 608 XP to 3 to 4 random pets so they age quicker or use their traits a bit sooner (like 41 seconds early).

Honey Bee

B Tier

Mutation Pet

Lets you farm guaranteed Pollinated plants (3x multiplier) faster than other bees. Aging it can reduce the timer.

Mochi Mouse

B Tier

XP Booster

Can grant 510 XP to itself and a small amount of XP per second to food-type critters like French Fry Ferret, Spaghetti Sloth, Sushi Beet, etc

Bald Eagle

B Tier

Hatch Related

Lets you hatch eggs 70.40 seconds faster every 7 minutes, not as good as Blood Kiwi, though.

Hamster

B Tier

Speed-Up Pet

Handy for crafting, as it boosts your crafting speed by 30.45% for 18.74 seconds every 3.05 minutes.

Meerkat

B Tier

Cooldown Pet

A critter that can lower another pet’s cooldown by 21.08 seconds every 7.14 minutes. Sometimes, it might even perform its ability again instantly after one round.

Golem

B Tier

Speed-Up Pet

If you’re mutating a pet, it goes to the Mutation Machine every 6.35 minutes and cuts its timer by 42.42 seconds.

Maneki-neko

B Tier

Resource Pet

Refunds fruits every two minutes when you sell them. The ability lasts for 10 seconds.

Caterpillar

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Makes leafy plants grow faster (Beanstalk, Corn, Pepper, Eggplant, etc.), but there are other crops that aren’t leafy.

Spotted Deer

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

Can duplicate your berry plants (Celestiberries, Grapes, Strawberries, Blueberries, Cranberries).

Giant Ant

B Tier

Harvest Related

Not as strong as Red Giant Ant , but it's still useful.

Monkey

B Tier

Resource Pet

Similar to Silver Monkey, just not as powerful.

Kodama

B Tier

Mutation Pet

One of the most useful pets in the 1.16.0 update. It lets your picked fruits turn into Tranquil .

Dog

B Tier

Seed Pet

It’s like a low-key version of a Golden Lab.

Toucan

B Tier

Plant Growth & Mutation

Allows your Tropical Plants (Mango, Dragon Fruit, Coconut, Cacao, and Watermelon) to mature quickly and gain a variant with a 1.18% chance.

Hedgehog

B Tier

Plant Growth & Variant

A less powerful version of the Blood Hedgehog.

Orangutan

B Tier

Resource Pet

It comes in handy when crafting often, as it offers a 3.43% chance to return materials to your backpack.

Crab

B Tier

Resource Pet

Only manages to snatch around 260 to 460 Sheckles every 6 minutes.

Brown Mouse

B Tier

Jump Height & XP Booster

Good for unlocking more pet slots since it ages fast (803.74 XP/10 min) and also boosts player jump height .

Panda

B Tier

Crop Value Booster

Bamboo is a solid money plant, and Panda increases its price even more.

Wasp

B Tier

Cooldown & Mutation

Shares the same abilities as Queen Bee and Tarantula Hawk, but has a weaker ability timer.

Echo Frog

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Speeds up a random plant’s growth by a full day every 10 minutes.

Dairy Cow

B Tier

Plant Growth & Seed Pet

Speeds up crop growth in a small range and can sometimes drop a Beanstalk seed when sold.

Cat

B Tier

Size Booster

Pretty much does the same thing as Orange Tabby .

Deer

B Tier

Fruit Duplicator

A version of Spotted Deer with lower chances of cloning berry plants .

Sea Otter

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Waters plants at different times to speed up growth, but since most crops grow pretty quickly, it mostly helps when you’re short on time or growing slower plants.

Kiwi

B Tier

Hatch Related

A weaker version of Blood Kiwi (helps lower hatching time to 20 seconds per minute).

Owl

B Tier

XP Booster

Shares the same abilities as Blood Owl and Night Owl, but it's not that solid.

Cow

B Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Helps with plant growth, making it spawn fruits real quick (about 1.12 times faster).

Rooster

B Tier

Hatch Related

Only raises egg hatching speed by 20%.

Flamingo

C Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Good for overall plant and fruit growth, but not as effective as the Triceratops.

Peacock

C Tier

Cooldown Pet

Reduces the cooldown of all nearby critters by 61 seconds every 9.58 minutes.

Orange Tabby

C Tier

Size Booster

Makes crops 1.5x bigger in size and weight , which increases their value.

Grey Mouse

C Tier

Jump Height & XP Booster

A less effective version of Brown Mouse .

Bee

C Tier

Mutation Pet

Produces Pollinated fruits , but it's slower than Honey Bee (24.45 minutes).

Frog

C Tier

Plant Growth Pet

Works like Echo Frog , but takes longer to activate its ability.

Chicken

C Tier

Hatch Related

Helps a little with egg hatching (boosts speed by 10%).

Bagel Bunny

C Tier

Crop Value Booster

Devours a carrot and increases its selling price by 5x.

Gorilla Chef

D Tier

Cooking Pet

Not really useful right now; it only helped in the second half of the Cooking update, where it gave you two meals instead of one with pretty high odds.

Seagull

D Tier

Seed Pet

May give you seeds from shoveled plants , but the odds are very low. You’re better off using a Reclaimer instead.

Black Bunny

D Tier

Crop Value Booster

Increases a carrot's selling value by 1.5x, but carrots aren't a top money-maker.

Bunny

D Tier

Crop Value Booster

Just a regular bunny that eats carrots and bumps up their selling value by 1.5x.

Best Pets in Grow a Garden

Most animals in Grow a Garden are super helpful, but a few of them stand out from the pack:

  • After the 1.15.0 update, Kitsuni has outshined all other fruit-stealing critters in Grow a Garden . It’s even better than Raccoon because not only can it steal a plant for you like Candy Blossom, but it also raises that plant’s value by 15x or even 90x before giving it to you.
  • Dragonfly and Butterfly are also OP critters since they give you the two most valuable variants in the game: Gold and Rainbow. These can blow up your plant's stacking bonus, taking their value from just a few million to literal billions.
  • Disco Bee can grant you Disco plants, which were once only available during rare Disco events. Each of these mutated variants sells for 125 times its original value. They are best used on plants with stacked mutations.
  • Mimic Octopus is one of the best critters in Grow a Garden . It can literally act as a duplicate pet. Place it with the Kitsuni, and it can become a Kitsuni for you. Same goes for any other pet.
  • Fennec Fox, T-Rex, and Spinosaurus are must-haves for mutations. One of the main differences is that the fox can steal mutations from neighboring farms (even Dawnbound, Plasma, and Voidtouched), while the dinosaurs can clone them from your own farm. Spinosaurus is especially useful when you want to stack mutations on your favorite fruits.
  • From the Fairy Updates, the Cockatrice and Luminous Sprite are the most sought-after pets. The former can turn your fruits into Gold or Silver variants, greatly increasing their mutation value, and can also perform several valuable actions, while the latter can add profitable mutations to your crops.

item.title: 7 Best Sonic Games For Online Play, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Sonic X Shadow Generations features online leaderboards for competitive gameplay.
  • Sonic Forces: Speed Battle enhances Sonic Dash style while focusing on online competition.
  • Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed offers addictive online play with varied characters and tracks.

While the Sonic the Hedgehog games are most commonly known for being single-player high-speed adventures, there have been a few instances where developers have also implemented multiplayer features to add replay value to the overall experience. Over the years, the minds behind the franchise have become quite creative in incorporating these multiplayer modes to ensure they still align with the core gameplay. While some modes allow multiple players to compete with one another to race toward the finish line, others are more experimental and unique.

It's always a nice bonus for a Sonic game to have these online options, since it encourages players to return to the game soon after they've already blasted through the main story. With that being said, the actual quality of the multiplayer can vary greatly between the games, but these titles are among the very best Sonic games to play for anyone looking to enjoy some online action with the Blue Blur and his friends.

7 Sonic Free Riders

Cruise Through A Variety Of Stages On A Hoverboard Along With Some Friends

Sonic Free Riders
Racing
Released
November 4, 2010
ESRB
everyone
Developer(s)
Sonic Team

Powered by

The third game in the Sonic Riders racing series admittedly received pretty poor reviews upon its release, though it does still include some fun online modes that can be enjoyed with a group of friends. Up to eight players can jump on the Extreme Gear hoverboards to partake in a race to see who can outlast the competition, and while the core gameplay may seem like more of the same, what makes it such a guilty pleasure is the Kinect compatibility.

The Kinect has always been a pretty clunky device, but it was still a ton of fun to use when playing with others, considering each player needs to focus their entire body on performing certain actions, such as drifting around the corner or bashing someone off their hoverboard. While Sonic Free Riders may therefore be a little boring when it comes to its single-player, there's still some fun to be had when jumping into the online modes.

6 Sonic Lost World

Lost World's Slower Pace Allows Four Players To Keep Up With One Another

Sonic Lost World
8.0 /10
Released
October 29, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Despite being released for both the Wii U and the Nintendo 3DS, Sonic Lost World can only be played online on the latter system, which is honestly still a pretty bizarre decision made by Sega. Despite that, 3DS owners can still enjoy racing against not just one, but up to three players at a time. This might sound a little chaotic on paper, but because Sonic Lost World has a slightly slower pace in its gameplay than many of the previous entries in the series, it makes it much harder for someone to shoot past the competition in the blink of an eye, creating a more even playing field.

Sonic Lost World also includes a healthy variety of otherworldly levels, which are all incredibly fun to explore with a friend or two. Being restricted to the 3DS version of the game, which includes inferior graphics and a smaller screen than the Wii U, is a little disappointing, but the fact that multiplayer was included in this game at all is still a nice treat for fans of the franchise.

5 Sonic X Shadow Generations

The Addition Of Online Leaderboards Encourages Players To Get Competitive

Sonic X Shadow Generations
9 /10
24
9.4 /10
Released
October 25, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Powered by

The Sonic X Shadow Generations remaster doesn't feature online play in the traditional sense, but there is still an online leaderboard for every single level in the game that will record the players' final time after beating a stage. Players are encouraged to replay these levels over and over again until they feel like they've fully mastered them, before then jumping into the online mode to test their top speed against players from around the world.

It's all so satisfying to see one's username move up even a space or two on the world leaderboards after nailing a level, but while this is already plenty of fun with Sonic, it's even more competitive with Shadow, given how much more difficult he is to use. Players need to know when and how to use each of Shadow's new Chaos abilities to reach the end of the stage with a record time, providing the game with even more replay value than it already had.

4 Sonic Forces: Speed Battle

Speed Battle Enhances The Sonic Run Gameplay Style And Takes It Online

  • Platform : Mobile
  • Release Date : 2017

After the enormous success of the unlimited mobile runner game Sonic Dash , it was inevitable that Sega would eventually develop even more mobile Sonic games in the future, considering there was a large audience for them. The result of this was Sonic Forces: Speed Battle , a game which plays fairly similarly to Dash , but which also places a much bigger focus on the competitive aspect of the gameplay. Players must do their best to navigate a wide selection of difficult stages from the series' past while also racing against three other players at the same time.

What makes the game so addictive is the staggering range of characters and unlockables that can be acquired over time. There's a wide variety of costumes and abilities that players can toy around with once they enter a stage, so while this might not be a fully-fledged mainline title, Sega still did a great job of making this a game that thrives in the online scene, especially thanks to how accessible it is.

3 Sonic Superstars

Eight Players Try To Survive Through Several Challenge Courses To Reach The Top Spot

Sonic Superstars
4.0 /10
Released
October 17, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

The fun, flashy, and vibrant Sonic Superstars feels like a heartfelt homage to the classic games of the series, but Sega made sure that this entry still feels modernized enough to meet today's expectations. One way they achieved this was by introducing four-player co-op, and while this can only be accessed locally, the good news is that there's also the online Battle Mode, which is much more competitive.

Up to eight players can compete in a variety of intense challenge courses, which play quite differently from the main game. In one level, players must try to survive a barrage of cannons by jumping between tiny platforms, while in the next, they will need to deal damage to one another by firing off giant lightning bolts. Needless to say, these minigames can get pretty wacky and weird, and while it definitely would have been nice to have seen online functionality baked into the story, this is still a nice compromise that helps to make up for this shortcoming.

2 Team Sonic Racing

A Unique Spin On The Racing Gameplay Formula Where Twelve Players Can Join In On The Action

Team Sonic Racing
5 /10
6.8 /10
Released
May 21, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Team Sonic Racing , as the name implies, isn't a game where players can finish a race by simply running solo, as they will also have two other partners on the track who can help them gain the upper hand. This provides a unique spin on the age-old racing gameplay loop, which works incredibly well when jumping online, especially if players already have two other buddies to accompany them when searching for other racers.

Team Sonic Racing is a game that looks and feels incredibly well-polished, being a true feast for the eyes and one of the best Sonic racing games ever made. While it's always fun to race around with a group of friends, the team mechanic also allows for some pretty interesting matchups that would never happen in the main story.

1 Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed

Tons Of Characters, Plenty Of Tracks, And So Much Fun To Be Had

Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed
7 /10
8.4 /10
Released
November 20, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Animated Blood, Mild Cartoon Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

What makes Sonic & All Stars Racing Transformed 's online so addictive is the amount of variety that it contains in terms of its characters and tracks. Not only are there a bunch of fan-favorite Sonic characters to play as, all of whom come with their unique vehicles that feed into their personality, but there's also a wide selection of other racers who also join in on the action, including the likes of Wreck-It-Ralph and Shinobi.

Players will enter each race in a standard vehicle, but as they go along the track, they will transform into boats or planes depending on the environment. This allows every race to feel completely different from the one that came before, and when playing with a full lobby of experienced racers, it can lead to competitions that are incredibly chaotic and unpredictable, but still a real joy to be a part of.

item.title: Best Open-World Games That Became Viral Sensations
item.description:
Most games salivate at the prospect of going viral, and this is especially true for indie gaming. The lack of AAA constraints allows these games to reach new heights as they let players enjoy imaginative gameplay loops.

However, in the case of open-world games, it's mostly the AAA hitters with massive budgets who have the marketing budget to make their games go viral... sometimes even before the game releases! It's a genre full of so many titles and expectations that only the most groundbreaking and newsworthy games have a chance of going viral.

Grand Theft Auto 5

A Viral Sensation That Is Still Relevant Courtesy Of GTA Online

5 Images
5 Images
Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10
150
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Pretty much every Grand Theft Auto game can fit the bill of being a viral open-world game. Grand Theft Auto 5 is no exception, with its trio of protagonists and technical achievements ensuring that the latest GTA game would become a barnburner in no time.

On top of this, the addition of GTA Online ensured that Grand Theft Auto 5 would be played by gamers for more than a decade after its launch, which is no mean feat. It speaks volumes about how ahead of its time GTA 5 was that players can still have a great time with this title, and it helps that the next-gen patch will make this game look better than ever on modern systems.

Minecraft

Microsoft Paid The Big Bucks To Acquire This Indie Phenomenon

6 Images
6 Images
Minecraft
190
9.0 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Minecraft is one of the greatest indie games ever made, establishing the modern template for future survival games to build upon. Even now, after all the years that have passed, Minecraft still has a dedicated fanbase that loves both the game's updates (barring a few recent exceptions) and the fan-made content for this title.

The game blew up and single-handedly turned its creator, Notch, into a billionaire. It's a viral phenomenon and the gift that keeps on giving, to the point where players with no gaming knowledge will still be familiar with Minecraft clips given how prominent they are on social media.

Cyberpunk 2077

Went Viral For Both Good And Bad Reasons

6 Images
6 Images
Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
116
9.0 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Cyberpunk 2077 is one of the greatest video games ever made, but it took a while for the game to regain this reputation after a botched launch. CD Projekt Red's latest open-world RPG made the rounds with stellar marketing that hyped it to the moon and back, only for an underbaked and unfinished final product to leave a sour taste in the minds of fans.

However, the company didn't give up on this title even after it became the punching bag of the video game industry for a while. They fixed the bugs, added more content, and revamped the gameplay systems, allowing Cyberpunk 2077 to enjoy the No Man's Sky treatment and become a lauded game, especially with the launch of Cyberpunk: Edgerunners , ensuring that this game would be relevant in the realm of pop culture once again.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

The Cultural Impact Of This Game Can Be Felt To This Day

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
81
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Skyrim is one of the greatest open-world RPGs ever made, with the sheer impact it had on the video game industry being clear as day. From the giants that sent the Dragonborn flying to the hilarious "arrow in the knee" memes, there's no shortage of ways Skyrim took over gaming pop culture.

People may laugh at Bethesda for re-releasing this game over and over again, but this approach has done a great job of helping Skyrim maintain its virality. This, coupled with a stellar modding community, ensures that players can boot up Skyrim and still have an amazing time with this title.

Elden Ring

Blew Up And Became The Most Popular FromSoftware Game

6 Images
6 Images
Elden Ring
10 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

FromSoftware's Dark Souls helped this studio reach new heights and establish a whole new gaming genre. However, while the Chosen Undead's adventures may make for the greatest and most important game made by this studio, Elden Ring 's virality and popularity ensured that it would be their most successful game by a country mile.

All of a sudden, George R.R. Martin's writing and the stellar open-world design ensured that Elden Ring would reach greater audiences than anyone could've expected. The excellent response to Shadow of the Erdtree and the experimental Elden Ring Nightreign makes it clear that FromSoftware will try to capture lightning in a bottle the same way they did with this genre-defining open-world RPG.

Red Dead Redemption 2

Arthur Morgan's Emotional Adventure Is A Tale For The Ages

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
170
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Red Dead Redemption 2 boasts one of Rockstar's best narratives by a country mile. Despite a slow beginning (which also became a viral discussion point), players love this title once it opens up and lets them gaze upon one of the most beautiful gaming worlds they've ever seen.

Arthur Morgan's adventures made for a fascinating time as players embarked on a journey for the ages with a group of outlaws in an age where they were getting left behind. The emotional high points of this masterpiece ensured that people couldn't stop talking about this game, even if Red Dead Online was a disappointment that failed to capitalize on the original game's popularity.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Geralt's Adventures Were In A Class Of Their Own And Helped CD Projekt Red Become A Beloved Company

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
55
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

The Witcher 3 is one of the greatest video games ever made, catapulting CD Projekt Red to the stratosphere of popularity. After achieving modest levels of success with the first two games in the series, Wild Hunt 's incredible writing and beautiful open-world environments helped it stand out as one of the best open-world titles around.

It single-handedly turned The Witcher franchise into one of the most mainstream series around, while the game's two expansions ensured that the game would be relevant for a long time. The next-gen patch is the cherry on top of this experience, encouraging players to replay this game and enjoy a new level of detail and beauty, something that was thought to be unimaginable given how beautiful the original game already was.

The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

Nintendo Blew Everyone Away With Their Work On This Incredible Open-World Zelda Adventure

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
48
9.2 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol, Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

When Nintendo revealed its plans to release a proper open-world Zelda game, fans didn't know what to expect. Pre-release impressions were mixed, but Breath of the Wild blew everything out of the water and established itself as one of the best video games of all time.

The organic open-world design was mind-blowing and ensured that players weren't constantly chasing map markers in the open world, like most other titles in the genre. The freeform design and malleable gameplay elements ensured that players would have a blast with this game, interacting with the community as they stumbled upon the game's many incredible moments and clever secrets.
